result.execSummary:
The defendant Demond L Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: If revoked, court orders 150 days jail.

Court will consider early termination of probation after 18 months.
Court will allow probation to be transfered to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No violent contact with victim M.W. listed in the criminal complaint.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Obtain a GED or HSED.
Domestic Violence counseling ordered.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered 43 days jail. Court grants 43 days credit. TIME SERVED

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Demond L Thomas did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2017 at 11:00 am.

The Defendant appears in person and Attorney Weitzner appears as a friend of the Court.  The Defendant qualifies and an attorney will be appointed by the public defender.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the witness listed in the criminal complaint.
